lines.text: [Needing a corpse for his boss's life-restoring experiments, William checks the morgue for a suitable body]
This one's got a lily in his hands. He may be dead, but he's neat about it.
[William mistakes the drunk and unconcious Peter for a corpse]
They must have embalmed him in Scotch and soda. He's so saturated if a breeze hit him, he'd ripple.
